meanings.sent1: Sometimes, I misperceive my friend's jokes as serious comments.
meanings.sent2: I often misperceive the time and end up being late.
meanings.sent3: Don't misperceive my smile as a sign of agreement.
meanings.sent4: She tends to misperceive criticism as personal attacks.
meanings.sent5: The fog made it easy to misperceive shapes in the distance.

meanings.definition: To have a mistaken or incorrect perception.
meanings.sent1: Children may misperceive shadows as monsters in the dark.
meanings.sent2: It is common to misperceive distance when looking through fog.
meanings.sent3: I misperceive my cat's meows as requests for snacks.
meanings.sent4: He tends to misperceive silence as disinterest.
meanings.sent5: The mirror's angle can make you misperceive your own reflection.
